Authors:
Zhanen Yang, Bo Zhang, Haixia Ma, Zikun Song, Xiaoyan Pan,
Zhi Qu
Title:
Two new species of Diatrype (Xylariales, Ascomycota) with
polysporous asci from China
Keywords:
Diatrypaceae, Polysporous asci, Taxonomy, morphology,
Phylogenetic analyses
Abstract:
In this study, two new species of Diatrype collected in
northeast China is described and illustrated based on morphological and
molecular evidence. Diatrype larissae from Heilongjiang Provinces is
characterised by having 36 perithecia in a stroma, asci polysporous,
ascospores allantoid, aseptate, slightly or moderately curved,
subhyaline. Diatrype betulaceicola has large stroma with 514
peri-thecia, perithecium immersed, asci polysporous, long-stalked,
ascospores allantoid, aseptate, slightly curved, subhyaline. The
phylogenies inferred from the data set of nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS)
and beta-tubulin (β-tubulin) supported the two new species as members in
the genus Diatrype and distinct species. The morphological similarities
and dissimilarities of the new species with phylogenetically close
alliances are discussed. A dichotomous identification key to the
Diatrype spp. known from China is proposed.
